result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:31 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant David N Hand in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for David N Hand.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard and requests a plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:57 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant David N Hand in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for David N Hand.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard on the status, matters are unresolved.  
Attorney Steiner confirms 22CF04 for Trial on this case.

2:32 PM Call to Order by Court for both cases.  Appearances stated: Defendant David N Hand in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for David N Hand.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Atty. Erickson states offer rcvd.; unable to resolve; requests trial.
     Court sets trial tentative for week of 9/20-23/22 for 22CF04 and 22CF38--Atty. Erickson to double check if both to be heard on that date.
     Court concludes at 2:35 p.m.
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:50 am.

2:20 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant David N Hand in court.  Attorney Wynes making appearance for Jeffrey Warren Erickson by video for David N Hand.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF04 along with 22CF38, 22CF62

Attorney Wynes is heard on the status of the cases.
Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:03 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant David N Hand in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for David N Hand.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard, defendant will waive preliminary hearing. 

Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 
Atty Erickson is heard and they are ready to proceed to arraignment. 

Atty Erickson is heard and defendant waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury status hearing on June 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:38 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant David N Hand in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for David N Hand.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
1:29 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant David N. Hand appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause.

State is heard on bond.  State requests a $250.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages nor enter any taverns. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard.

Court orders a $250.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages nor enter any taverns. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages nor enter any taverns. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw
